text: Council is a city in and the county seat of Adams County, Idaho, United States. The population was 867 at the 2020 census. According to the United States Census Bureau, the city has a total area of , of which was land and (2.4%) was water. ==Population history== *2020 - 867 *2010 - 839 *2000 - 816 *1990 - 831Moffatt, Riley. Population History of Western U.S. Cities & Towns, 1850-1990. Lanham: Scarecrow, 1996, 91. *1980 - 917 *1970 - 899 *1960 - 827 *1950 - 748 *1940 - 692 *1930 - 355 *1920 - 388 *1910 - 312 *1900 - 177 *1890 - 77 *1880 - 60 ==Notable people== *Harriet Miller, American politician ==Transportation== U.S. Route 95 goes through the city, connecting it to New Meadows to the north and Cambridge and Weiser to the south. ==References== ==Other websites== * City website * The Adams County Record, local newspaper Category:Cities in Idaho Category:County seats in Idaho
title: Council, Idaho
